title: Wrapper functions for random variables
text: goal distributions …

title: Wrapper functions for random variables
text: can install development version distributions GitHub :

title: Wrapper functions for random variables
text: basic example shows define standard normal random variable. can use sample density methods either generate random numbers random variable evaluate density function. example, can generate collection 100 random points evaluate density function 1. ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . also use GitHub Actions re-render README.Rmd every time push. example workflow can found : https://github.com/r-lib/actions/tree/v1/examples.
code: library(distributions) x <- GaussianRandomVariable$new() x #> <Gaussian> #>   Inherits from: <ContinuousRandomVariable> #>   Public: #>     density: function (x, log = TRUE)  #>     initialize: function (mean = 0, sd = 1)  #>     mean: 0 #>     sample: function (n = 1)  #>     samples: function (nsamples = 1, ...)  #>     sd: 1 class(x) #> [1] "Gaussian"                 "ContinuousRandomVariable" #> [3] "R6" x$sample(100) x$density(1)

title: BetaRandomVariable object — BetaRandomVariable
text: Defines Beta random variable. uses backend functions defines Beta random variable. definitions distributions R6 object. Tha parametrization used $$X \sim \mathsf{Beta}(\alpha, \beta)\,,$$ parameters \(\alpha\) \(\beta\) parameters defining Beta random variable.

title: BetaRandomVariable object — BetaRandomVariable
text: random variables distributions defined R6 objects. fields (referenced ) needed objects R6::R6Class. context defines specific instance random variable used. , public fields parameters random variable \(\theta \\mathbb{R}^p\), \(p\).

title: BetaRandomVariable object — BetaRandomVariable
text: distributions::ContinuousRandomVariable -> Beta

title: BetaRandomVariable object — BetaRandomVariable
text: alpha (double, positive)  first parameter distribution, \(\alpha > 0\). beta (double, positive)  second parameter distribution, \(\beta > 0\).

title: BetaRandomVariable object — BetaRandomVariable
text: BetaRandomVariable$new() BetaRandomVariable$sample() BetaRandomVariable$density()

title: BetaRandomVariable object — BetaRandomVariable
text: Generates Beta ContinuousRandomVariable object specified parameters alpha (alpha) beta (beta).

title: BetaRandomVariable object — BetaRandomVariable
text: alpha (double, positive) first parameter. beta (double, positive) second parameter.

title: BetaRandomVariable object — BetaRandomVariable
text: Generates random variables using stats::rbeta() function.

title: BetaRandomVariable object — BetaRandomVariable
text: nsamples (integer) number random numbers generated behaves like random variables.

title: BetaRandomVariable object — BetaRandomVariable
text: (array) random numbers distribution.

title: BetaRandomVariable object — BetaRandomVariable
text: Evaluates density function using stats::dbeta() function.

title: BetaRandomVariable object — BetaRandomVariable
text: x (array) evaluate density function. log (Boolean) indicates evaluating log-density.

title: BetaRandomVariable object — BetaRandomVariable
text: (array) evaluations x.

title: BinomialRandomVariable object — BionomialRandomVariable
text: Defines Binomial random variable. uses backend functions defines Binomial random variable. definitions distributions R6 object. Tha parametrization used $$X \sim \mathsf{Binomial}(n, \theta)\,,$$ parameters \(n\) \(\theta\) number independent trials rate (probability) success.

title: BinomialRandomVariable object — BionomialRandomVariable
text: random variables distributions defined R6 objects. fields (referenced ) needed objects R6::R6Class. context defines specific instance random variable used. , public fields parameters random variable \(\theta \\mathbb{R}^p\), \(p\).

title: BinomialRandomVariable object — BionomialRandomVariable
text: distributions::DiscreteRandomVariable -> Binomial

title: BinomialRandomVariable object — BionomialRandomVariable
text: n (integer)  number independent trials, \(n\). theta (double, constrained)  probability success independent trial, \(\theta \[0,1]\).

title: BinomialRandomVariable object — BionomialRandomVariable
text: BinomialRandomVariable$new() BinomialRandomVariable$sample() BinomialRandomVariable$density()

title: BinomialRandomVariable object — BionomialRandomVariable
text: Generates Binomial DiscreteRandomVariable object specified number trials (n) probability success (theta).

title: BinomialRandomVariable object — BionomialRandomVariable
text: n (integer) center distribution. theta (double, constrained) dispersion around center distribution.

title: BinomialRandomVariable object — BionomialRandomVariable
text: Generates random variables using stats::rbinom() function.

title: BinomialRandomVariable object — BionomialRandomVariable
text: nsamples (integer) number random numbers generated behaves like random variables.

title: BinomialRandomVariable object — BionomialRandomVariable
text: (array) random numbers distribution.

title: BinomialRandomVariable object — BionomialRandomVariable
text: Evaluates density function using stats::dbinom() function.

title: BinomialRandomVariable object — BionomialRandomVariable
text: x (array) evaluate density function. log (Boolean) indicates evaluating log-density.

title: BinomialRandomVariable object — BionomialRandomVariable
text: (array) evaluations x.

title: GaussianRandomVariable object — GaussianRandomVariable
text: Defines Normal random variable. uses backend functions defines Gaussian random variable. definitions distributions R6 object. Tha parametrization used $$X \sim \mathsf{Normal}(\mu, \sigma)\,,$$ parameters \(\mu\) \(\sigma\) mean standard deviation, respectively.

title: PoissonRandomVariable object — PoissonRandomVariable
text: Defines Poisson random variable. uses backend functions defines Poisson random variable. definitions distributions R6 object. Tha parametrization used $$X \sim \mathsf{Poisson}(\lambda)\,,$$ parameter \(\lambda >0\) denotes rate ocurrence events.
